犘字的基本解释

犘
má
传说中古代生长在中国四川的一种大牛，重千斤。

犘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［má］
［《廣韻》莫霞切，平麻，明。］
牛名。

犘字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【牛字部】　犘； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页703第31
【廣韻】莫霞切【集韻】謨加切，?音麻。【玉篇】牛名。【廣韻】重千斤，出巴中。【司馬相如·上林賦註】李東壁云：犛牛，爾雅之犘牛。

犘字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
犘字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
P
má
According to legend, a big cow that grew up in Sichuan, China in ancient times, weighs a thousand catties.
P

["Guangyun" Mo Xiaqie, Pingma, Ming. ]
The name of the cow.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Siji 2] [Cow Character Department] 　犘; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: page 703 31
[Guang Yun] Mo Xiaqie [Ji Yun] Mo Jiaqie,? Yin Ma. 【Jade articles】The name of the cow. [Guang Yun] weighs a thousand catties, leaving Pakistan. [Notes to Sima Xiangru·Shanglin Fu] Li Dongbiyun: Yak, the yak, the yak.
